body: Good point, would you want to reword the first one? Thanks for the PR in advance!

I'm relatively new to Akka, which explains why I read the documentation, and I really am unsure which is the right definition.

There seem to be [other](http://doc.akka.io/docs/akka/2.5.2/scala/general/addressing.html#what-is-an-actor-path-) [mentions](http://doc.akka.io/docs/akka/2.5.2/scala/general/addressing.html#actor-reference-and-path-equality) of the term in the documentation -- along with the actor life-cycle diagram -- all of which seem to coincide with the first definition. With this in mind, looks like the second section ("initialization patterns") is the one that should be revised.

You are right, a restart doesn't bump the "incarnation". It's the same
actor from the outside.

Stop followed by a start will result in new incarnation, i.e. ActorRef
pointing to the old incarnation is useless, messages sent via old ActorRef
will not be delivered to the new Actor incarnation.

/Patrik
l√∂r 27 maj 2017 kl. 16:03 skrev eyalroth <notifications@github.com>:

> and I really am unsure which is the right definition.

> mentions

> mind, looks like the second section ("initialization patterns") is the one
> that should be revised.
>

> .
>

In that case, I don't think I can revise the second section. My knowledge of the framework and its internals is fairly minimal, hence I would have to guess what is the right description of its functionality.
No problem. We'll take this one. Thanks for spotting. Other PRs for more obvious thinks are welcome when you read the rest of the docs.

issue.title: Being consistent on explanation of actor incarnations

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

issue.body: Refs #23035 <- the issue describes everything about the intention of the change.

body:
I submitted a pull req. When the core team has time, please see if that makes sense?

@eyalroth FYI I created [a gist](https://gist.github.com/richard-imaoka/28d8e754bdba21f6d485b163c6767e7c) demonstrating the behavior of restart, and stop followed by actor re-creation.

@richard-imaoka nice!

I think you'd want to add a `println` for the second child at [this part of the gist](https://gist.github.com/richard-imaoka/28d8e754bdba21f6d485b163c6767e7c#file-myactorincarnation-scala-L140) to demonstrate the ID of the newly created incarnation.
Hi am new to Akka. What is the difference between incarnation and UID ? What is the usage of incarnation and UID ? When it is being created ?
